title: Quake largest of 4 huge ones this year
author: Reuters
text: A magnitude-8.4 earthquake that hit South Sumatra on Wednesday is the largest of four of magnitude 8 or stronger that have hit worldwide in 2007 and the most powerful to hit Indonesia since the magnitude-8.6 earthquake in March 2005, according to the U.S. Geological Survey (USGS). Here are the others: Jan. 13: East of the Kuril Islands, which stretch between Japan and Russia, magnitude 8.1. April 1: Solomon Islands, east of Melanesia, magnitude 8.1. Aug. 15: Near the coast of central Peru, magnitude 8.0. All four locations are on the Pacific "Ring of Fire," a horseshoe-shaped 25,000 mile-long arc of volcanoes and fault lines that generate about 90 percent of the world's earthquakes. Wednesday's quake was the result of thrust faulting at the boundary of two tectonic plates — the Australian plate and the Sunda plate.
